借.definition: to borrow; (used in combination with 給|给[gei3] or 出[chu1] etc) to lend; to make use of; to avail oneself of; (sometimes followed by 著|着[zhe5]) by; with

借一步.definition: could I have a word with you? (in private)

借以.definition: so as to; for the purpose of; in order to

借位.definition: in arithmetic of subtraction, to borrow 10 and carry from the next place

借光.definition: excuse me (i.e. let me through, please); reflected glory; to benefit from sb else's prestige

借入方.definition: borrower; debit side (of a balance sheet)

借刀殺人.definition: to lend sb a knife to kill sb; to get sb else to do one's dirty work; to attack using the strength of another (idiom)

借助.definition: to draw support from; with the help of

借勢.definition: to borrow sb's authority; to seize an opportunity

借口.definition: to use as an excuse; excuse; pretext

借古喻今.definition: to borrow the past as a model for the present

借古諷今.definition: to use the past to disparage the present (idiom)

借命.definition: to live out a pointless existence

借單.definition: receipt for a loan; written confirmation of a debt; IOU

借單兒.definition: receipt for a loan; written confirmation of a debt; IOU

借喻.definition: to use sth as a metaphor

借宿.definition: to stay with sb; to ask for lodging

借屍還魂.definition: lit. reincarnated in sb else's body (idiom); fig. a discarded or discredited idea returns in another guise

借支.definition: to get an advance on one's pay

借方.definition: borrower; debit side (of a balance sheet)

借東風.definition: lit. to use the eastern wind (idiom); fig. to use sb's help

借款.definition: to lend money; to borrow money; loan

借殼.definition: (finance) to acquire a company as a shell

借火.definition: to borrow a light (for a cigarette)

借用.definition: to borrow sth for another use; to borrow an idea for one's own use

借箸.definition: lit. to borrow chopsticks; to make plans for sb else

借花獻佛.definition: lit. presenting the Buddha with borrowed flowers (idiom); fig. to win favor or influence using sb else's property; plagiarism

借讀.definition: to attend school on a temporary basis

借貸.definition: to borrow or lend money; debit and credit items on a balance sheet

借賬.definition: to borrow money; to take a loan

借過.definition: excuse me (i.e. let me through, please)

借重.definition: to rely on sb for support

借錢.definition: to borrow money; to lend money

借鏡.definition: (Tw) to draw on (others' experience); to learn from (how others do things); lesson to be learned (by observing others)

借鑒.definition: to draw on (others' experience); to learn from (how others do things); lesson to be learned (by observing others)

借題發揮.definition: to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas; to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
